intro: Carpodinus hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy carpodine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage.
